body:
yes, the dot folder issue was resolved recently: https://github.com/owncloud/core/pull/5862
i'm not sure why you still can't create files on serverb as it was working a few days ago, need to try it again.

the problem is only when creating new files from the web ui.
refreshing the browser will make them appear afterwards though.

uploading files work fine.

sync client seems to have trouble as well :frowning:

i just cloned the latest core from git and confirmed that the changes were there and tried again (without changing my setup) and it still does not work.

just to reiterate what i am doing. i have two owncloud machines (s and c) and a mac with a sync client. c imports a folder from s. the mac syncs everything c knows (including the folder it imports from s)

- when i add files to the folder on s (using new->textile for simplicity) i see the changes on c as well as on the mac. 
- when i add a new file to the folder on c (again using new->textile for simplicity) i see the new file on c, but not on s or the mac. when refreshing c, the file is gone.
- when i add a new file on the mac (using touch), the sync-client errors out with an internal server error

adding a new directory works on all three. if it works for you, maybe this is a problem on my end? separately both installations (s and c) work fine. i can sync them with the mac and create new files. it is just this imported folder that behaves odd.

yes, the workflow is as follows:
sync client upload -> webdav interface of c -> c -> webdav interface of s -> s

there is a problem at the "webdav interface of c -> c -> webdav interface of s" level.
see #6068

just found this in the servers error log
[tue nov 26 21:14:33 2013] [warn] [client c] mod_fcgid: stderr: resource not found., referer: https://c/index.php/apps/files?dir=/dirfroms

hm, too bad then. so if i read that correct, syncing from two different ownclouds is not possible until 7.

yes, sorry :frowning: 
there is an issue with part files which can't be resolved without making bigger changes. and as oc6 is close to release, bigger changes are likely to introduce regressions.

the one thing that should already work is uploading to the backend owncloud using the web interface.
yeah, saw that discussion. i suppose webdav does not support file locks, as that would be the default approach to handle files that are in a transient state (ie. being updated).
